INT STORM DRAIN TUNNEL, (10 MINUTES LATER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jewelry District in Downtown L.A. Neon signs splatter light across racks waterfalling with gold. Oddly no one i out and about. Something major happened. Empty sidewalks glisten with glass from bullet shattered windows. Police cars everywhere. Blocking the street. Yellow tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORO FANTASIA -- A jewelry store where four bad guys are trapped. On the phone with the cops. The BARRICADED ROBBER seems cooperative, calm.

dialogues.speaker: BARRICADED ROBBER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We wanna come out. I'll go back to the joint and do my time like a man.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA FINDS
dialogues.text: PUSH IN -- A SWAT SNIPER has carefully created a camoufla nest, tucked away, ready.

dialogues.speaker: BARRICADED ROBBER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We afraid to come out. We know you got snipers and helicopters waiting to bust our heads, you know?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE NEGOTIATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (reassuring, paternal) Not gonne happen. Your lives are just as important as the hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a SWAT SUBURBAN is parked. Several SWAT OFFICERS, t most highly trained cops on the force, in big vests and helmets, guard the area. World class athletes at the top their game. Six of them pour through an alley, stealthy infiltrators probing cautiously ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LEADING THE WAY
dialogues.text: Round a dumpster and approach a heavy back door. Years together in the Marines and on L.A.s mean streets have cemented their friendship and they act as one. One is JIM STREET, he looks more skateboarder than cop, indomitably cheerful, he makes everything looks easy. The other is POKER, an ambitious, preppy type from the So (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They arrive at a formidable gate topped with coils of raz wire, an impassable obstacle. Poker and Street clamber over-it without pause. Amazing. The remamining four SWAT OFFICERS hang back. Among them i HONDO, one gifted SWAT Cop. With years of experience, he' road worn and stronger than spring steel. The guy you wan on your side. The boss of this six man crew is SERGEANT HOWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Street stands guard as Poker picks the lock of the steel door's deadbolt. CLICK. He unlocks it, grinning. Street oils the hinges with WD-40, slowly pulls the door open. Wedging it open with a rubber stop. This reveals @ second door of formidable iron bars. They can hear VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: Beyond the bars, a dark HALLWAY leads to the jewelry stor up front. A SECURITY GUARD with a stomach wound is tied up with duc tape. Ashen from shock, he SEES Poker and Street, pleads for help with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Street makes a "Shhh" sign. Undezstood. Street and Poker trade looks. Street's radio earpiece CRACKLES and GARBLES. He speaks against his throat mike.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Say again. More CRACKLES AND GARBLES.

dialogues.speaker: STREET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Poker, you get that?

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. Radio interference. Street steps into the alley so Hondo can see him, Street and Hondo converse with handsigns. Street returns Poker, still working the lock. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Hondo says the Sergeant wants us to pull back. The negotiator is making progress and doesn't. want the suspects spooked.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: Hol√© on. Almost got it. Poker intently picks the lock of the security bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aiz is thick with fear. There are three COUNTER GIRLS who range from stoic to plain scared. The MANAGER is out cold on the floor, pistol whipped, a knot on his temple. BR BARRICADED ROBBER ard three ACCOMPLICES, are trapped. Hardened gangsters, they are oddly calm, fatalistic.

dialogues.speaker: BARRICADED ROBBER
dialogues.text: (into phone) I got kids, man. I don't wanna leave no orphans. We're comin' out, boss. ACCOMPLICE 1‚Äù You ain't got no kids. The Barricaded Robber covers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BARRICADED ROBBER
dialogues.text: Shut up. I'm buying time, here. Load up your guns. We shootin' our way cut. Get ready to run fast as you can and blast anything moving. His men check their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACCOMPLICE 2 removes his mask. Revealing his face to 4 Ccunter Girl whose blindfold he has removed, his intentio are Clearly lascivious. The Barricaded Robber drops the phone and crosses to him, shoves him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BARRICADED ROBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Idiot. Why'd you do that? Keep your ugly mug covered. He drags his accomplice toward the back, out of earshot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARRICADED ROBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take that bitch over there and cap her, dog. The Barricaded Robber returns to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BARRICADED ROBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {into phone) Yo, boss. Can we get a pizza up in here? Accomplice 2 drags the Counter Girl down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Street and Poker heard everything. They trade alarmed loo Poker works the lock faster.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: They're gonna waste her. Street uses an INSPECTION MIRROR to peer down the hallway INSERT -~ INSPECTION MIRROR P.O.V. ACCOMPLICE 1 drags the terrified COUNTER GIRL by her arm.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Street tries the radio. Nothing. No time to think it through. Poker and Street trade looks, reaching a decisio Street grabs the BREACHING SHOTGUN, designed for blasting open doors, strapped to Poker's back.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Knock-knock. He jerks the trigger -- BOOM-KA-BOOM! The compact shotgun fires Shock-lock slugs -- That SHATTER the HINGES. Poker raises a boot and KICKS the door. WHAM! - CLANG! Th two super cops charge inside. / CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poker and Street move with quick precision -- BRDDDT! The shoot short bursts from their MP-5 submachine guns with n telepathic coordination. ACCOMPLICE 1 is hit -- He drops to the ground. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leaving the COUNTER GIRL freaked out but unscathed.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Go. Get outside. She darts out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: ON STREET
dialogues.text: As he pulls a flashbang stun grenade from his vest. Pulis the pin and tosses it into the store. BANG! -- Deafening noise, a BLINDING FLASH. CuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHRIEKING Counter Girls. Poker and Street charge in firin their MP-5 submachine guns.

dialogues.speaker: BRDDDT-BRDDDT
dialogues.text: ACCOMPLICE 2 raises his magnum ~- He drops. Poker took hi out. ACCOMPLICE 3 hoids his pistol under the chin of a Countex Girl. BRDDT! Street fires hits him without hesitation. He drops like a rag doll. The woman is unscathed.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARRICADED ROBBER
dialogues.text: Raises his pistol -- Poker and Street fire simultaniously BRDDDDT! -- Their bullets bounce off the BODY ARMOR prote the Barricaded Robber's chest. ¬´ The Barricaded Robber fires back -- POP!

dialogues.speaker: HIS BULLET
dialogues.text: Slams into Poker's helmet -~ DUNK! -- RICOCHETS OFF. Poke is stunned. Street fearlessly charges forward, tackles the Barricaded Rebber. Punches him in the jaw. Poker regains his senses, moves in and cuffs the Barricad Robber. Street catching his breath. Grabs the phone off the floor Poker checking the fallen Accomplices. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poker helps him up. They survey the area. Then they trade

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Suspects in custody. We're code four. .

dialogues.speaker: POLICE NEGOTIATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Swat. We have people down. Roll up the paramedics. Street tosses aside the phone. looks, tap fists and trade relieved grins.

dialogues.speaker: STREET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got ‚Äòem.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming in!

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: Hondo enters. He surveys the scene. Looks at Poker and Street, angry and amazed.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys are in treuble. Big daddy is mad. Hondo steps aside. SERGEANT HOWARD enters, very unhappy. He looks at Street and Poker.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT HOWARD
dialogues.text: I told teld you te recon the locks on the back door. Not whack and stack three suspects.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: One of the suspects was going to kill a hostage.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT HOWARD
dialogues.text: They could have killed both of you and the hostages and everyone else. You forgot the team. treet reacts. Four PARAMEDICS enter lugging trauma kits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‚ÄòA beat. Poker looks at Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Street and Poker wait in crisp dress uniforms. They are nervous, tense. Bravado has yielded to anxiety. Two Old Detectives cross to them,. shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: OLD DETECTIVE 1
dialogues.text: Whatever happens in there, you guys are heroes.

dialogues.speaker: OLD DETECTIVE 2
dialogues.text: They should be giving you medals.

dialogues.speaker: STREET / POKER
dialogues.text: Thanks. The old-timers walk away. Street and Poker trade uneasy looks.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: I think we're getting fired.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: No way. I'll quit first. The door to an office opens, revealing Sergeant Howard. H nods for Poker and Street to enter. cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT CAPTAIN, the big boss, sits at his desk, trunk s arms crossed. Sergeant Howard stands by his side like an attack dog. Street is stoic, but hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I respect your abilities, you guys ere high performers. But your judgment is low grade at best. Swat can't use people who don't do what they're told. Cut your patches eff. You two are being reassigned to regular patrol. Street looks at the SWAT patch on his shoulder like he'd rather part with his leg.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT CAPTAIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be grateful you're not being fired. Sergeant Howard hands them both letters to sign. Poker sh his head in dismay. Street's hopes are dashed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: eC) STREET fe Respectfully, sir. Everyone in this PS building knows we did the right thing. ‚Äò : I have a two foot high stack of thank you letters from that girl's family. The irony isn't lost on the SWAT CAPTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: You two were insubordinate. That is the issue on the table. (a beat) Sometimes doing the right thing isn't doing the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: Sir, we didn't have time to ask "mother may I." The right thing to do was clear and simple from what we saw and heard.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: People died.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: & The Lad guys died, sir. That woman Y . was about to be executed right in front of us. The Swat Captain stands, leans forward ominously and gets real quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Officer Martin, Officer Street. You don't run Swat. I do. It's that simple. Poker gets a faraway look in his eye. He turns to Street.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: Away from here. Street hesitates. And that smacks of betrayal to Poker. Poker charges out of there. SLAMS the door. ( e SERGEANT HOWARD You better cool him off while he has @ chance. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‚Ç¨ QO Yessir. Street quickly exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gloomy rainy day. Poker bursts out the door. Walking angrily across the lot between rows and rows of black and whites. A beat. Street exits the door, catches up.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Hold up, man. Poker turns, vindicated.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come around, brother.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: You're punching out? You're walking?

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: ~ . ‚ÄòI'm running. I have better thines VO to do than rack up miles on a city of . car. Poker points at a tired broken police cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Don't bail like this.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: We joined LAPD to work Swat. You want to be just another body on the shift, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: All you know how to do is run jump, fight and shoot. We'll work nights ina fast division. We'll rock the house. . Poker isn't stopping.. Street gets in his face. Where you gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: . . POKER
dialogues.text: @ Bali. Australia. Costa Rica. Big ( World. C'mon, let's check it out. Street considers it a beat. Poker hopeful. Then:

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: No, man. I don't wanna go out there and drift. I did that. It sucks.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: I got skills. I'll find a job. Right there, their friendship is over.

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: Rather reign in hell than serve in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: POKER
dialogues.text: It means I won't stay here and be their bitch. (a beat) I'm not a punk like you. Street swings at Poker. Poker retaliates with blocks and punches. They fight in the rain, brutal, animalistic. Tearing thei uniforms, ruining patent leather shoes. This is one aweso fight. Poker gains the upper hand. Gets Street in an armlock. Street pinned, he can do nothing, in agony.

dialogues.speaker: POKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I twist this way, the bone snaps clean. Heals in six weeks. I twist this way ... You'll never be the same. SNAP! -- Poker breaks Street's arm. ¬´Fight over. Poker stands, spits blood. Street clutching his shattered arm i agony.

dialogues.speaker: POKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Better get that looked at.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: I will. Poker walking away.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Hey, Poker. Good luck in hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Street lays on the asphalt, woozy with pain. Uniformed le gather around Street, hands help him up. :

dialogues.speaker: SUPER TITLE
dialogues.text: A cold dark night in Vienna. This locals only cafe is qui Some American pop on the juke. JAQUE sits at a table chainsmoking, a typical euro hipste nervously waiting. A door opens. A large man in a suit named GQ gestures him inside. GQ is intimidating, and a bad dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon entering Jaque REACTS. - The room is lined with butcher paper. A human body is nea wrapped in the corner. Clinical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX DE LEON, disheveled, exhausted. A beer and a smoke i his bloody hands. He's oddly charismatic, clearly very shrewd. Leaning against the wall, relaxing after his exertions. He gestures for Jaque to sit on a paper covered chair.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You came here to face me like a man. I respect and appreciate that. Thank you. JAQUE . What can I say, Alex? They say we choose our fates but I never stole from you. My family is my concern now.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: There is no threat to them. You are very brave. Alex gets a cell call, checks the number, ignores it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You knew Larry's hand was in my pocket? Jaque nods: yes. Alex notices his nice watch. Gestures fo it, Jaque guiltily hands it over. Alex admires it. GQ approves. Alex puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How does the money disappear? Where is the break in the chain?

dialogues.speaker: JAQUE
dialogues.text: Larry skims the cash in Los Angeles and drives it into Mexico, he has accounts there. I found this out today. To help you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jaque. Alex likes hurting people, it's hard for him to cut Jaque . some slack.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You earned this. Quick. No pain.

dialogues.speaker: JAQUE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Alex. Alex dismissively waves, nods to GQ who raises his pistol Jaque -- POP! Alex crosses to the sink, washes his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Let's go to California. GQ reacts. .

dialogues.speaker: GQ
dialogues.text: We might not come back. ALEX . Buy some bulletproof passports. I have to take the risk. If I do not kill this cancer it will destroy my business. ‚ÄòAlex dries his hands, tosses the towel on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Burn this trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Street running et full tilt, weaving through, over and ar parked cars. He bisects @ homeless camp. . Street approaches a large concrete fortress -- LAPD CENTR STATION -- flashes his ID to the GUARDS. Vaults the concr barriers without slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite an armada of vehicles. Suburbans. Pick-ups. Unmarke cars. Two SWAT TRUCKS are on stand-by to serve as mobile armories and command posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crammed into an out of the way corner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An amazing essortment of SWAT gear ranging from the munda to the exotic. There are helmets, radios, vests and armor A myriad of tools. Office supplies. Lockers of flashbang grenades and ammo.

dialogues.speaker: FIND STREET
dialogues.text: Flush from his run, in a police uniform that suggests off comfort, he pours hot coffee in a sports bottle. Adds cre sugar. A fistful of vitamins. Some protein powder. Shakes it. He slurps the concoction as he settles into a desk swamped with stacks of paperwork. Street has a shrine to better days --¬∞ Shooting trophies, SWAT Olympics trophies. Photos of him on the SWAT Team.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS FROM THE CAGE
dialogues.text: A dozen SWAT COPS in crisp fatigues stampede out a briefi room. BOXER and TJ, both young proven Swat officers, cros to the cage. TJ isa high achieving perfectionist, young and arrogant with pristine hair and teeth. Boxer is a little overweight with five O'Clock shadow. A low key, go with the flow kind of guy. Street has boxes of ammo on the counter ready for them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: sO Hey, Boxer. ‚Äò : BOXER Morning, Street.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: I heard a new crew is manning up.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: I heard we're getting a raise. I don't see that happening. You've been around too long to listen to rumors. Boxer is a bad liar. Street grins.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: C'mon. I'll find out anyway when the Captain has me outfit them.

dialogues.speaker: BOXER
dialogues.text: Yes. They're adding a six man element to the duty rotation.

dialogues.speaker: -STREET
dialogues.text: And Hondo's gonna run it.

dialogues.speaker: ' BOXER
dialogues.text: No comment.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Talk to him Boxer. I'm ready for a comeback shot.

dialogues.speaker: TI
dialogues.text: Hondo doesn't need a trigger happy has-been. Street glares, if looks could kill. ‚ÄúSTREET Keep talking shit, TJ. To (to Boxer) Be honest. Would you want Street rescuing your grandmother?

dialogues.speaker: BOXER
dialogues.text: Sure. Street's good. (@ Hondo approaches the cage. TJ and Boxer grab the ammo . and cross to the Suburbans. Now it's just Hondo and Str (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‚Äò@

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Sergeant Hondo.. Hondo gives Street a look.

dialogues.speaker: STREET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get used to it, you're a supervisor now. Sew those on yourself? Street points at the brand new Sergeant's patches sewn on his sleeves.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Last night.. They're finally making me grow up, I guess. Street rolls up his sleeve, revealing shiny scars where h shattered arm was pinned and braced. Street makes a fist.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Look at that. All healed now, a hundred percent. Passed my physical. Honde, I am on. My skills are razor sharp. I'm better than I was two years ago. Hondo looks at Street.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Why you telling me all this? I'm just signing out ammo here.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: C'mon. You're sergeant now, you're in line for the new crew.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: What makes you think that out of six hundred highly qualified bad-ass applicants you have any chance?

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: I was born to work Swat. You know I'm better than all them. Hondo walks away, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Still giving that survival class? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: om, ‚Äò¬Æ 16.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Twice a week. Maybe you could come down and teach a class sometime.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Maybe. Hondo crosses to some waiting vehicles in B.G.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Saddle up and move out! I wanna shoot guns and break shit. The SWAT Cops mount their vehicles. A flurry of activity they pull out. Street watches them depart from behind wire mesh. It's quiet again. Street looks around his cage, as if realizing for the ten thousandth time:

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: This sucks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: iNT. CENTRAL DIVISION - WEIGHT ROOM - NIGHT In the basement of the crowded and decrepit police statio A dozen OFFICERS work out before the night shift with wei and machines. All ages and sexes, all sizes and colors, tough cops working a deadly division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exercise mat where Street, in a wrist brace, gives mar arts instruction to four SHIFT COPS, in sweats. They wear gun belts with red rubber training pistol s. A cocky ROOK has Street handcuffed.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Okay. This is a WWF move I saw once. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE
dialogues.text: Ready. Street moves fast; trips the Rookie. Who CRASHES to the mat. Street wraps his legs around his neck. Snatches the rubber gun from beit, holds it to his head.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Bang. Rule one of officer survival: stay alive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street smart Rookie is surprised to have lost the upp hand. .

dialogues.speaker: STREET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I train here every day. If you want to stay alive out there, I can teach you what works.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'll come through. Hondo enters. Street is surprised to see him.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Yo, people. Listen up! I heard you guys are the baddest shift in L.A.P.D. Who wants to join Swat? Everyone stops. And raises their hand. Including Street, wondering what Hondo is up to. HONDO (CONT'D) . Whe's the baddest cop in here? The cops trade leoks -- BERMUDEZ is quickly singled out. He's a battle hardened old timer with ten years more experience than Street. Hondo knew they would pick him.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, Bermudez, get on the mat there with Officer Street.

dialogues.speaker: BERMUDEZ
dialogues.text: Thanks for this shot, Hondo. I've been testing for Swat since forever.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: We'll, take care of you. Hondo and Bermudez cross to Street on the mats.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, guys. The winner of this fight gets to be on the new team I'm putting together. Street senses a set-up. Wary of Bermudez. STREET . Hondo, if I kick his butt, I can be on your crew? x @ A beat. Hondo is on the spot, but his money is on Bermu (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll see what I can do. (grins, RE: Bermudez) He's a triple black--belt. Street reacts. Bermudez gives him a mean stare. BERMUDEZ . You don't stand a chance, youngin'. Let's get down. They shake and bow. Bermudez raises big knurled fists. Street REACTS, intimidated. Cops circle around them. Bermudez attacks. The THUP-THUP sound of fast punches bei blocked. Street is on the defensive. Bermudez is really going for it. But Street endures the assault. They CRASH into weights, bang into machines. End up on th floor. Fighting like badgers, until Street gets hold of Bermudez's arm and nearly pulls it out of it socket befor Bermudez quits.

dialogues.speaker: BERMUDEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okey! Tap! Tap! Shit. - Street lets gc, surprisec he won, as is everyone else. Honde is left scratching his head by the upset. Bermudez looking at Hondo.

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
dialogues.text: Sorry, the kid won. Bermudez is disappointed but a good sport. He shakes with treet. Who puffs with pride at his achievement. He taps fists with some buddies. He lifts his shirt to show 4 cra tattco across his.stomach.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: That's right. The Street sweeper dominates. Hondo doesn't like the attitude. Street realizes that, gr serious, but expectant.

dialogues.speaker: STREET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what's up, Hondo? I took him. Honde looks at Street, not liking the spot he got himself into. A beat. He tosses Street his cuffs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HONDO
